Posts.Content: I received results from Fusion Biopsy today. Out of 15 cores, one had a Gleason Score of 6. Prostate size is 86 cc. The recommendation is for Active Surveillance. Almost as an afterthought, I was offered Proscar. I have no real urinary issues. Any thoughts as to why Proscar would be a benefit? I understand that it can have several sexual side effects.
Posts.Title: Proscar for Active Surveillance

Posts.Content: I am a little surprised that with only one core at Gleason 6 @5%, that you were able to get the Da Vinci. You were only 65, which might have been the tie breaker. MDA just said Active Surveillance with no input from me. I have looked at the FDA warning for Proscar. I have also read a follow up study that tends to discount the increased incident of more active cancer. I am somewhat concerned about the sexual side effects, especially the loss of libido. Seems to occur in about 3% of those taking it, but the effect diminishes with time. Comments??
Posts.Title: Proscar for Active Surveillance

Posts.Content: LowLight: I too don't know what kind of thinking your DR. was doing. Doesn't make any sense do the biopsy first and then the MRI. Great job. Just keep pressing on. I was being easy on my DR. when I said he agreed to the PHI. I had to DEMAND that he do it. He wanted to just do another PSA and see which direction it was going and wait another 6 mo. If it was up, then the MRI. Down, keep waiting. This is a long journey, isn't?
Posts.Title: What have been your experiences with new PHI test

Posts.Content: Just got back my PHI results.. Not good 70 (53%probability). PSA was down from last test and fPSA remained good at 27%. If I had not demanded to get the PHI test, my doc. would not have recommended the MRI as the next step. MY URO center has at least 9 prostate cancer DRs. MY test was the first the center had sent off. Go figure. I am working now with MD Anderson for an appointment. Does anyone have Doctor recommendations for me.

Posts.Title: What have been your experiences with new PHI test

Posts.Content: After 6 negative biopsies, and one positive PCA3, I was able to convince my Doc. to write an order for the PHI (Prostate Health Index). Now waiting on results. Latest PSA was 7.6, fpsa 27%. I am asking for your experience with the test (PHI) and how reliable the results might be. Depending on the result, the next step may be an MRI.
Posts.Title: What have been your experiences with new PHI test

Posts.Content: That is my plan. No 3T Mp-mri in Arkansas. Will probably ask for referral to MD Anderson. That way if biopsy is required I could get fission there.

Posts.Title: What have been your experiences with new PHI test

Posts.Content: Just got my biopsy results from MDA after MRI and Fusion biopsy they are: MRI RESULTS: Marked benign prostatic hypertrophy , limiting assessment for prostate cancer in the peripheral zone. Possible tumor to left of midline and another in the left mid gland.( both of the areas tested negative in the biopsy) No extraprostatic extension, seminal vesicle invasion, or lymphadenopathy. BIOPSY RESULTS: 13 Cores all negative, most show focal atrophy. 1 core Gleason 3+3, less than 1.0MM focus. Note: This is the same location that had a High Grade PIN in October 2011. Both the MRI and Ultrasound showed a very large prostate at~96cc. I am 74 years old and otherwise in good help. MDA recommends AS. I will meet with my local Uro. to discuss the situation next month. My thoughts that might push me toward surgery vs. AS: 1. I am in good health now so would be to my benefit to get it done now, rather than wait 2 or 3 years. 2. If in several years, I were upgraded to an 8, chances are they would push for seeds. With such a large prostate, they would require the drugs that shrink it which takes another 6 months or longer and make you feel terrible. 3. With this large prostate, cancer or not, I will probably require some sort of procedure to cure urine retention. I would really like both pro and con comments. What are your thoughts??
Posts.Title: Gleason 6, Should I press for surgery?

Posts.Content: shu246 and Joe1. You are right; this is a tough decision. Not even sure I could convince a surgeon to do the Da Vinci. What I didn't mention is that I have had 7 biopsies over 12 years and the prospect of 3 or 4 more as a part of AS is not very appealing. As far as PSA, I am now in the 10+ range. It has taken probably 6 years to go from 4 to 10. If I elected to go with AS, with my large prostate, I would probably need to take Proscar at some point which has a significant risk of destroying libido. If my cancer were upgraded at a later date, my only option would be external beam radiation. Not my favorite form of treatment. I seem to have found myself in the never, never land between age, low Gleason score, and a massive prostate. Not a great place to be.
Posts.Title: Gleason 6, Should I press for surgery?
